description:
go.blog: fold the profiling Go article
also fixed a few remaining references to `gopprof`.

messages.text:
Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

I'd like you to review this change to
https://code.google.com/p/go.blog
Thanks for this but can you also please make sure new sentences start on a new line? Makes it easier to edit the HTML down the road; it's a habit I'm trying to establish.
Does it stil format correctly in the article? It should, just want to check

Yes, the need for one-line-per-paragraph is a property of blogger but
not present.

-rob

On Sun, Jun 2, 2013 at 9:20 PM,  <adg@golang.org> wrote:
> Does it stil format correctly in the article? It should, just want to
> check
>
> https://codereview.appspot.com/9784046/

On 3 June 2013 11:38, Rob Pike <r@golang.org> wrote:

> Yes, the need for one-line-per-paragraph is a property of blogger but
> not present.
>

It is a property of present, too. IIRC you can use line breaks to manually
flow text in .slide files. I think it's a property of the output templates.
It should work fine here.

Andrew

For .article files, the flow is what we want here. Look at
splash.article for an example.

-rob

Hi Rob, now that this CL is submitted, could you (or somebody else)
please push the new content to app engine?

i've fixed two typos in this CL. Thank you.

Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com, r@golang.org, adg@golang.org (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

Please take another look.

*** Submitted as https://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=2f8ebab56084&repo=blog ***

go.blog: fold the profiling Go article
also fixed a few remaining references to `gopprof`.

R=golang-dev, r, adg
CC=golang-dev
https://codereview.appspot.com/9784046

On 10 June 2013 01:16, minux <minux.ma@gmail.com> wrote:

> Hi Rob, now that this CL is submitted, could you (or somebody else)
> please push the new content to app engine?
>

Done!

subject: code review 9784046: go.blog: fold the profiling Go article
